title: Lesson 1: Parts of Speech
description: Learn about stuffs involving parts of speech!

sections.heading: Nouns
sections.text: Nouns are words that name people, places, things, or ideas.
examples: The teacher instructed her students in the classroom.
Happiness is a warm puppy.

sections.heading: Pronouns
sections.text: Pronouns replace nouns to avoid repetition.
examples: She is reading a book. It is very interesting.
They went to the park, and they enjoyed themselves.

sections.heading: Verbs
sections.text: Verbs describe actions or states of being.
examples: The children play in the garden.
He is a doctor.
She thinks about the problem carefully.

sections.heading: Adjectives
examples: She wore a beautiful dress.
The tall man walked with a quick pace.

sections.heading: Adverbs
sections.text: Adverbs modify verbs, adjectives, or other adverbs. They often end in '-ly'.
examples: He ran quickly to catch the bus.
The test was extremely difficult.
She spoke very softly.

sections.heading: Prepositions
sections.text: Prepositions show the relationship between a noun or pronoun and another word in the sentence.
examples: The cat is on the table.
He walked to the store.
She is good at playing the piano.

sections.heading: Conjunctions
sections.text: Conjunctions connect words, phrases, or clauses.
examples: I like tea and coffee.
She is smart but lazy.
He studied hard because he wanted to pass the exam.

sections.heading: Interjections
sections.text: Interjections are words that express strong emotions and are often followed by an exclamation mark.
examples: Wow! That's amazing!
Ouch! That hurts!
Oh no! I forgot my keys.
